positive.review:
Really enjoy it! My home country of Greece didn't nominate for the World Cup, so I like to recreate the Greek team and live out the fantasy, just like every other aspect of my life.

Oh yeah, I put also put Ronaldo on the Greek team which is a huge plus +++
Good for a free to play game. The only issue is inconsistency of gameplay, poor connection from time to time, but overall, it is a good game.

The gameplay in eFootball 25 is genuinely good. It feels more realistic compared to EAFC, which relies a lot on skill moves. Matches here play out more naturally, and it’s easier to enjoy the football itself.

I’m neutral about the card releases every Monday and Thursday. They can get expensive, but at the same time, Konami does give free-to-play players decent cards so they can still compete.

My only concern is the power creep. We already have a player reaching 110 overall (Ibrahimovic), while most free cards only have an overall of 102. The max free-to-play card has 104 OVR (Batistuta) with the appropriate booster, so the gap is slowly getting bigger.

Still, for the gameplay alone, it’s worth trying. It's free anyway.

so, I've been playing this game on mobile/pc/console, since 2021, and to be fair I think it's the best free-to-play football game you can play right now. 
Efootball PES 21 was the best football game KONAMI ever released, and it was perfect... But then, the very next year, KONAMI announced that they'll make the game free to play and will end the legacy of "PRO EVOLUTION SOCCER". The new name that have remained was "Efooball".  When everyone was hyped for the next update, the game wasn't really reaching the expectation. They killed the most loved game mode of the game by the community, the master league. I was pretty annoyed that they released some game modes, and the edit mode to, but i still played the game. The graphics were awful (at least on the console/pc), you couldn't even think that's "a newer game" than the PES 21. At launch, it was unplayable. most of the players deleted the game and returned to PES, or started playing FIFA. Even I gave up, but not entirely. You see, I was still playing on my mobile phone with my friend, because it was miles better than FIFA mobile, and rarely on the console with a cousin. The next year, KONAMI made a huge update, when they "fixed" a bit the graphics and the game became a bit enjoyable, they also gain more licensed team. In Efootball 2024 they added a new game mode where you can play co-op with other players, and you could finally add your friends ID so you can invite to play with you easier. And again, the graphics became to look better. The next edition they've done better, and this year even better.
What I'm trying to say, is that KONAMI really tried to make a free-to-play football game that you can enjoy playing it and make it better and better as the year past, and I really look forward to see what they'll bring next.
very good football game. realistic and bvery good
This game is good many people may think it is like fc games it is a bit but only ultimate team there is no career mode you can play vs ai or real people
The game is very realistic, the physics, the graphics have improved so much this year, really love playing this

This is the best football game currenly in the market. There is a lot of things that needed to be fixed but it has the best gameplay out there. Graphics, menu and other features are not good yet but the gameplay is everything. PES always had better gameplay than any other game on the market. 

I would say give it a chance and you might like it if you can go past some pay to win elements like overpowered epics cards, trash graphics for pc , smart assist etc, 

just play it for the gameplay.

The games are fun and more like Real football, slower and more tactical than EA or UFL, None of which work on Linux without Grand levels of workarounds. Ive Only played against AI not PvP and its better than other AI opponents like EA. Its fine and you dont need to spend money on coins if you dont want to as you can earn players and items to get you started. BUT to be honest the Pay/Gamble scheme for Legends and higher rated players is disgustingly expensive. Approx £150 for 20,000 coins to get the Latest Ibra and Platini is not a microtransaction its a Downright ROBBERY Macrotransaction. Whether you NEED higher rated players to win online, they no doubt help. There are some players/managers you can get that arent very expensive and as a free to play game spending a small amount to boost your starter squad is feasible. The main part being is the game Fun and enjoyable to play, yes it is, does it have faults and improvements that could be made yes it does. Worth trying out imo.

This has to be my favorite game in my 30 years on this earth. The gameplay is the smoothest its ever been in the series and as someone whose played the previous PES games this is by far the best out of them. The people complaining about the connection are simply broke and need to get better internet like I did specifically for this game. Every thursday I look forward to spend my hard earned money on the new legends so my team can be the best and I can gatekeep free to play players from getting their 100 coins from events.

eFootball has improved over time, but it still feels a bit inconsistent. The gameplay can be fun and realistic at moments, but player movement and animations sometimes feel awkward. Graphics and online performance are decent, but not always stable. Overall, it’s an okay free football game, just not on the same level as older PES titles yet.

eFootball is a gotcha mobile card game, that is using the brand recognition of pro evolution soccer. If you accept that it is in fact not a simulation but a collectible card game, there are reasons to appreciate this game. Naturally its focus is customer satisfaction, so that people who pay for the cards have a good time. Most of the money is made on mobile, therefore there is a constant effort to make mobile players competitive. This was accomplished by trimming the manual features of pro evolution soccer that were incompatible with mobile gameplay. There are options for manual player swapping, shooting, passing etc. but these options are underdeveloped and punishing, thus generally avoided by competitive players. The game uses an event based system, so that your inputs are assessed as either successes or failures according to player attributes and an appropriate simulation of the event is generated and presented in the screen. For example in pro evolution soccer a pass or shot would deviate from their target numerically on the map so a bad passer would pass the ball to X:12 Y:18 rather than X:10 Y:20. In eFootball "the bad pass" is determined as failure and a result from the failure table is generated. So the pass will either go out, either go directly to the defender or the keeper. A bad pass will never end up in a random place in order to speed up the gameplay. This doesnt depend on how much you press the button, which actually determines who the pass is directed to. So you can press the pass button as hard as you like, the pass will many times leave your feet gently ending up on a defender. If you increase the manual option it will go out more often, without providing you any meaningful gameplay options since nobody cares to develop manual gameplay as it is inaccessible for mobile. If you decide to cross the ball it will check player skills and attributes, after which it will produce a cross event. How much you press the loft pass button will affect who the ball is aimed, whereas the quality of the cross depends on player attributes much like football manager. You are going for a header but do you have aerial superiority and heading skills, if not you will most of the time miss the target standing right in front of the goal. Putting a side the fact that standard (free) players fail what amateur players accomplish routinely in real life, for a manager game it even has good gameplay. You make the decisions for your players and try to interrupt AI scripted attacks. PES in mid 2000s and onwards are miles better than anything eFootball has presented so far but here is the thing, they are football simulation games. This just aint it.
This was the first ever football game i've played. I really enjoy it, i scored a goal after stealing the ball of someone lol.

As someone who grew up on the old PES games, eFootball has been a weird ride. It’s definitely not the same classic experience, but it has slowly improved over time. The gameplay feels decent now — player movement is smoother, passing is sharper, and dribbling has that old PES vibe in some moments. Still, you can feel the game is built around a free-to-play model, so content and modes are limited unless you’re okay with grinding.

On my RTX 4050 + Ryzen 7 HP Victus, it runs super smooth — 120–150 FPS on high, no issues at all. It’s lightweight, so the laptop barely heats up.

Pros

✔ Solid gameplay, especially passing and ball control
✔ Good animations after recent updates
✔ Still has flashes of that classic PES feel

Cons

✘ Limited modes compared to old PES
✘ Free-to-play grind isn’t for everyone
✘ Updates are inconsistent in quality

Overall: Not the PES we remember, but it’s playable and improving. If you miss the old PES mechanics, you’ll find moments here that still feel like the good days — and performance on the laptop is flawless.

⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️ 4/5 – Football 

This football game hits the sweet spot between fun and competitive. The gameplay feels smooth, the passing is sharp, and when everything lines up for a perfect goal, it’s genuinely satisfying. The graphics and animations add a nice layer of realism, and the different modes give you plenty to do — whether you just want quick matches or a full career grind.

It’s not flawless, though. Sometimes the AI does weird things, and a few mechanics feel unbalanced. Online matches can be hit-or-miss depending on matchmaking. But overall, the moment-to-moment gameplay keeps you hooked.

4/5 — a strong, exciting football experience that delivers more highs than lows.

negative.review:
developers, you realize me and a lot of other people would much rather pay 70$ for you to release a full, complete game with career mode than pay EA 70$ for their garbage. Why do you guys not capitalize on EA's continued failure? gameplay wise, this game is miles ahead (other than the bullshit scripting that still happens). It feels way more like you are playing authentic football rather than some arcade bs. Yeah it has problems too, but it's more enjoyable gameplay wise. 

Unfortunately, that gameplay can only be used for this ultimate team cash grab. Very sad to see

perfect example of how to ruin a francise.
i would like to ask for a refund even when i got it for free.
well done konami...

Horrible pay-to-win game, more pay-to-win than FIFA somehow. Bad gameplay, always bad connection, takes a while to find a match sometimes. At least FIFA has SBC's which is a good way to grow a good team, but in this game, yes, they give out a lot of free stuff, but it's just horrible stuff that doesn't make an impact on your team. As someone who got top 100k, the reward was not worth it. It's always a player who is bad and doesn't help the team at all. There are limited ways to get new players. You either gamble in packs or save up for packs that are 750 coins for managers and players + managers are 1,200 coins or more. Or you hope they give out a good free icon. Once you get to DIV 3 and above, the game is just not rewarding enough for what you have to deal with. They don't even have a reward per match; you have to wait till the season is over, which is about a month and a half or something. Not even 5 eFootball coins per match win, and you just face the pay-to-win teams who miraculously get all the rebounds and make your defense forget how to defend. Also, the passes don't go where you aim them, servers are horrible feels like I'm playing in mud. There is more, but I'm over this. Just don't play.

I’ve been a PES fan since 2003, and I didn’t even know Konami had killed PES until one day I stumbled onto eFootball. At first, it was fun — until the AI showed its true colors.

The Legend difficulty is straight-up ridiculous. The AI pulls off impossible passes, laser–accurate shots, and nonstop fancy skills like they’re playing a different game. Fine, whatever. But what pushed me over the edge is how my players suddenly turn into clueless, slow, useless robots.

They react late, they pass the ball straight to the opponent, they freeze on simple plays, and half the time it feels like they’re stuck in mud. And don’t even get me started on shooting. There are moments where I should score easily — open net, perfect timing — but somehow the ball hits the bar, bounces out, or the keeper turns into Prime Buffon. Every. Single. Time.

Meanwhile the AI scores with the dumbest, weakest shots imaginable.

Honestly, don’t install it. It will ruin your mood. It doesn’t feel fair, it doesn’t feel balanced, and it definitely doesn’t feel like the PES I loved. Konami really destroyed something special.

This is one of the worst games I have ever played and I have played a lot of games. They rigged the game against you so you can spend money and buy fancy bull crap players that they themselves would make bad so you feel the need to buy new players again. If the game need you to loose, trust me you would loose. If you ever feel the need to spend money on this game, know that the players you buy would be nerfed in like 1 month of the purchase. Its like all the players of the game know that the AI influences the game heavily, if the game needs you to loose, you are going to loose no matter how good you play. Your defenders and players begin to play weirdly, loosing the ball in dangerous places so your opponent can score. Going back to Fifa and my other adventure games.

Firstly, the game’s rank and matchmaking system is absolutely terrible. Players with top-tier cards get matched against players with much weaker squads. Some teams troll on purpose, and some players deliberately run down the clock, especially when they’re leading late in the match. Sometimes, when you’re in Division 6, you can even face the world’s 5th-ranked player… It’s complete nonsense. But on the bright side, the game also has its good aspects and can sometimes be fun. Still, I wouldn’t recommend it.

This game is trash, i play it because i played efootball 2020-2021 and i thought that was something like that, but the truth is, this game is trash, i can say it after having played a lot.
I even wasted about 80-90 dollars, just cuz been fan of some players made me waste in the game, before starting to play online and realizing how bad it is.
This game is about:
Who was the better players, and who has the faster players.. the meta is to have only fast players.
Does that sound like a terrible game? well maybe not, if it was just that...
The game has also some form of script that decides to help one side.. if the game decides you are going to lose, even if you shoot on target 25 times in a game, you wont score (i had that more than once), but your oponent may shoot 1 or 2 times and score each time, and sometimes if it can score, your own goalkeeper or defenders may do the job for your rival.
Is that not enough.. well then lets talk of servers.. you get trash servers.. i had a qualification game, i was winning (here on PC) my nephew was playing it on PS5 and my other nephew on the Series X.. i scored (needed to win to get to next league) and i got DCed.. well you would think was my net.. nope.. my nephews were still playing fine the same stupid game. Then ofc i lost the game, because the retarded system doesnt not let you rejoin the game.. i had this more than once, y saw oponents having the same thing.. and no, i dont feel great for having a free win, because i know i hate when i lose for the same reason.
And to top it all, you get sometimes some of your ballers refusing to go to the ball, running to a ball that was through by the other side, and was go be outside the court, but they run and your team is the one who loses the ball.. sometimes the players refuse to kick the ball.. 
Oh i forgot, faults.  I dont really play dirty, but the funny thing is, sometimes the game lets the other guy kick your players the whole game, sometimes not even a yellow card, but if you "press" on the other guy players, you get a yellow card,  and even got a red card once, in a game where the fault count was something like 13 to 1 (i  had 1) and the other guy only got like 2 yellows, while i got a red card.. and 23 where the ones i got called, problably the real amount was something like 25.

The game will mess with the postions of the defenders, the rating of the players, your delay, passing and I am writing this comment after a 0-1 loss totaly dominating the game with 16 clear shots with no goals and my opponent did one through pass and manage to win. The worst thing is I knew I was going to lose and I knew exactly how. So the game will mess with your shooting aswell. This is a joke of esport game!

Honestly, eFootball is a masterpiece in testing your patience! The controls feel like they were designed just to remind you every day how little patience you have. As for the bugs? Don’t even get me started—sometimes the ball flies more than the players, and your player suddenly decides to stop moving, like he just lost connection to life. 

And the greed... oh, that’s a love story with no end. The game basically decided you can’t win unless you spend money buying players—who will probably play against you right after! And those scripts? Feels like the match outcome is already decided before you even start. But we keep playing, laughing at ourselves, hoping next time will be different… but it never is, of course!

This game makes me frustrated every time. Bad defense, ball control often goes off, passes don't match player directions and so on. It's not it. Feels extremely cheap and fake. Sadly EA have taken over the contractual rights to use the names of the real teams, thus the names of real teams are disguised under weird nicknames. Some teams are real, some are not -- if it was 100% either way the game would feel a bit better.

I find controls to be more responsive and less sticky if compared to the competitor, but overall I can't enjoy it whatsoever. The UI, those tokens, points feel like a mobile game, and I can't be convinced to commit to it.

Would recommend for you to try if you feel like, since it's free. But I'm uninstalling and won't be coming back.

Not the most honest game out there. I was playing in Division 6, logged in after a few days, and all of a sudden, I'm playing in Division 8. This isn't the first or second time. Also, during the game, when it was 0-1, I had gotten a penalty kick, but it disappeared suddenly, and I ended up starting the game from the middle. Quite weird. I understand the game is free, but it feels like they're just trying to sell their AI nonsense to the highest bidder who’s convinced by the propaganda. Also I was interested in the game because of Konami reputation for good games. This aint one unfortunately.

Played it enough. There are a lot of bad things here more than good things. I know I shouldn't expect much from a free game, but that doesn't mean I'll let it pass. First of all, some of the controls are very confusing. The dribbling system here is just non existent (yes, I checked the dribbling controls). As long as your character is better than the other, you will NOT get past that character. Which also says that this game is p2w. It wouldn't have been much of a problem until the matchmaking is so sh*t in this game because it pairs you with pros much more often, which means you have to fight players with advantage over their roster. I also dislike the sign up awards. That means everyone has the same roster than you and most likely, they've probably played more than you which just means you'll get squished by the players there. Not to mention stuff like delay, lack of roster, lack of strategies and controls, etc. Like I said, I shouldn't expect much from a free game but I still have huge standards for something that's been around for a long time. I definitely have more to complain but this is most of what I have encountered in this game.

eFootball is the strangest heartbreak: a free-to-play football sim with some of the best on-pitch feeling in the entire genre. The gameplay is wonderfully grounded, the animations often whisper realism, and compared to FC26’s hyper-arcade physics, eFootball feels like stepping onto actual grass instead of a neon trampoline.

And that’s… pretty much where the praise ends.

The game has almost no content to speak of. Most of what does exist is just a carousel of card players you’re nudged to buy with real money. No arena, no proper training mode like FC26 has, no league-style progression, no career alternative, nothing to sink your teeth into unless your teeth are already shaped like a credit card.

And where is a Pro Clubs-style mode? One of the most beloved experiences in FC — completely ignored here. I’d live in that mode if it existed. Konami seems determined to pretend it doesn’t.

Graphically, the game took a time machine — backward. PES 2021 looks better in almost every way, while eFootball often resembles a console port of a mobile game (and the mobile-style menu UI only makes that impression stronger).

But the real villain wearing the referee’s uniform is the scripting. The AI has an invisible thumb on the scale, especially helping players with Pass Assist 1/2 and Smart Assist turned on. These assists practically play for you, rewarding the most repetitive, creativity-proof playstyles as long as you’ve bought the right overpowered cards.

Manual controls (FUMA) don’t just lack support — the game feels like it punishes you for daring to use them. Finesse/Controlled Shot on manual is so poorly implemented it might as well be a placebo animation.

eFootball has a brilliant football heart…
But everything around it — the modes, the systems, the assists, the progression, the scripting — feels like it escaped from a different, far cheaper game.

If Konami ever decides to build a full game around this beautiful gameplay core, we’d have a masterpiece.
Until then, it’s just a fantastic match engine trapped inside a content desert.
